paragraphs.content: The song of songs, which is Solomon’s.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The song of songs, which is Solomon’s.

paragraphs.content: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine.

paragraphs.content: Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.

paragraphs.content: Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.

paragraphs.content: I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

paragraphs.content: Look not upon me, because I am black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother’s children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; but mine own vineyard have I not kept.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Look not upon me, because I am black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother’s children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; but mine own vineyard have I not kept.

paragraphs.content: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?

paragraphs.content: ¶ If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.

paragraphs.content: I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots.

paragraphs.content: Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, thy neck with chains of gold.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, thy neck with chains of gold.

paragraphs.content: We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.
paragraphs.contentHtml: We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.

paragraphs.content: ¶ While the king sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ While the king sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.

paragraphs.content: A bundle of myrrh is my wellbeloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A bundle of myrrh is my wellbeloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.

paragraphs.content: My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of En-gedi.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of En-gedi.

paragraphs.content: Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves’ eyes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves’ eyes.

paragraphs.content: Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed is green.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed is green.

paragraphs.content: The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir.
